meanings.definition: A substance that increases the pH level of a solution.
meanings.sent1: I added an alkalizer to the water to make it less acidic.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used an alkalizer to raise the pH of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The alkalizer danced around the solution, turning it less sour.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an alkalizer, brightening the mood of the room.
meanings.sent5: The alkalizer worked its magic, transforming the liquid into a base.

meanings.definition: A medication that neutralizes acid in the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed an alkalizer to soothe his patient's stomach.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps an alkalizer handy in case of acid reflux.
meanings.sent3: The alkalizer joked with the stomach acid, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as an alkalizer, calming her anxious stomach.
meanings.sent5: The alkalizer swiftly tackled the acid, bringing relief to the patient.
